title: How to Make Your Own Cadbury Creme Egg

steps.headline: Combine the corn syrup, butter, vanilla and salt in a large bowl.
Add sugar slowly, mixing at the same time.
steps.description: The mixture will get very thick and hard to stir, so use a wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Place 1/3 of the mixture into a smaller bowl.
Add 4 drops of yellow and 4 drops of red food coloring and stir.
steps.description: This will color the mixture orange for the yolk.

steps.headline: Cover and refrigerate until both mixtures are firm, at least 2 hours.
Roll a small ball of orange and cover with a layer of white filling twice as thick.
steps.description: Shape into an oval egg shape for a more "authentic" look. Pick up a teaspoon-full of the mixture, and scoop it from one spoon to the other until it takes the egg shape that you want.

steps.headline: Place the egg onto a greased plate.
Repeat until all eggs are created.
Combine chocolate chips with shortening in a glass bowl and microwave on high for 1 minute.
steps.description: Stir, then heat for another minute.

steps.headline: Dip each egg into the chocolate to coat.
steps.description: Stick a toothpick or fork into the egg to help you handle it.

steps.headline: Place onto a rack to allow any excess chocolate to drip off.
Allow to cool for 1-2 hours, then re-dip in chocolate.
Refrigerate for 1-2 hours so the eggs harden completely, then enjoy.

text: Combine the corn syrup, butter, vanilla and salt in a large bowl. Beat thoroughly. Add sugar slowly, mixing at the same time. The mixture will get very thick and hard to stir, so use a wooden spoon. Place 1/3 of the mixture into a smaller bowl.  Add 4 drops of yellow and 4 drops of red food coloring and stir. This will color the mixture orange for the yolk. Cover and refrigerate until both mixtures are firm, at least 2 hours.  Roll a small ball of orange and cover with a layer of white filling twice as thick. Shape into an oval egg shape for a more "authentic" look. Pick up a teaspoon-full of the mixture, and scoop it from one spoon to the other until it takes the egg shape that you want. Place the egg onto a greased plate.  Repeat until all eggs are created.  Refrigerate for another 3-4 hours.  Combine chocolate chips with shortening in a glass bowl and microwave on high for 1 minute. Stir, then heat for another minute. Dip each egg into the chocolate to coat. Stick a toothpick or fork into the egg to help you handle it. Place onto a rack to allow any excess chocolate to drip off.  Allow to cool for 1-2 hours, then re-dip in chocolate.  Refrigerate for 1-2 hours so the eggs harden completely, then enjoy.
